channel.title: Need help with PI for my beta team to get access to my server. Hamachi
channel.description: Hello! I need to make my beta testers able to connect to my server through hamachi.. But somehow it won't work. I tried with just the hamachi ip, changing it in client.java [ONLY]. Then I tried with no-ip, but no.. help?

item.title: Need help with PI for my beta team to get access to my server. Hamachi
item.dc:creator: @makersprivate123 makersprivate123
item.description:
@makersprivate123 wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:18, topic:472494”][quote author=makersprivate123 link=topic=590281.msg4179869#msg4179869 date=1355382449]

In the meantime, heres a tutorial I made that’ll hopefully help you portforward with ease:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,590760.msg4179823.html#new

Thx, but I already know how to portforward.
I have been using servers in like 3 - 4 years. First Habbo xD, Then Garry’s Mod, Then Tf2, Then Css, Then Minecraft and now this
[/quote]

Then do it ;)[/quote]

Look what I said:

[quote=“makersprivate123, post:15, topic:472494”]I know all this, but I can’t access my hosting computer right now so I can’t put portforward where I am at right now.
I am going there tomorrow.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.source: Need help with PI for my beta team to get access to my server. Hamachi

item.title: Need help with PI for my beta team to get access to my server. Hamachi
item.dc:creator: @makersprivate123 makersprivate123
item.description:
@makersprivate123 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:14, topic:472494”][quote author=makersprivate123 link=topic=590281.msg4178447#msg4178447 date=1355254999]
Hello! I need to make my beta testers able to connect to my server through hamachi…
But somehow it won’t work.
I tried with just the hamachi ip, changing it in client.java [ONLY]. Then I tried with no-ip, but no… help?
[/quote]

  1. Hamachi is the WORST way to get a server online. You’d be 1000% better off port forwarding.
  2. You do NOT need to port forward with Hamachi.
  3. The IP you change is in client.java for your client. The server, it depends on what base.
  4. No-ip is a IP masking service. It would mask your current IP, unless you told it to mask the Hamachi IP.[/quote]
    I know all this, but I can’t access my hosting computer right now so I can’t put portforward where I am at right now.
    I am going there tomorrow.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with PI for my beta team to get access to my server. Hamachi

item.title: Need help with PI for my beta team to get access to my server. Hamachi
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“makersprivate123, post:1, topic:472494”]Hello! I need to make my beta testers able to connect to my server through hamachi…
But somehow it won’t work.
I tried with just the hamachi ip, changing it in client.java [ONLY]. Then I tried with no-ip, but no… help?[/quote]

  1. Hamachi is the WORST way to get a server online. You’d be 1000% better off port forwarding.
  2. You do NOT need to port forward with Hamachi.
  3. The IP you change is in client.java for your client. The server, it depends on what base.
  4. No-ip is a IP masking service. It would mask your current IP, unless you told it to mask the Hamachi IP.

Read full topic

@ezzi wrote:

Go in Jframe.java and if I’m correct, scroll… Never mind do Ctrl + f and search 127.0.0.1 I believe you have to change the IP in there as well.

item.title: Need help with PI for my beta team to get access to my server. Hamachi
item.dc:creator: @iBunnie iBunnie
item.description:
@iBunnie wrote:

[quote=“ohokay, post:11, topic:472494”][quote author=makersprivate123 link=topic=590281.msg4179224#msg4179224 date=1355334116]

Your IP is in client.java?

Ofc, yes.
[/quote]

I don’t understand your problem then, if it doesn’t work your ports aren’t forwarded correctly…

canyouseeme.org

Edit: Someone said you don’t need ports for Himachi, may be correct I don’t know, but when I used it, I did my ports and it worked fine. You do the same.

Also to save yourself trouble, don’t even use it. It’s simple enough to set up without using Himachi.[/quote]
Hamachi doesnt require you to portforward, he must be missing an IP somewheres.

Read full topic

Your IP is in client.java?
[/quote]
Ofc, yes.[/quote]

I don’t understand your problem then, if it doesn’t work your ports aren’t forwarded correctly…

canyouseeme.org

Edit: Someone said you don’t need ports for Himachi, may be correct I don’t know, but when I used it, I did my ports and it worked fine. You do the same.

Also to save yourself trouble, don’t even use it. It’s simple enough to set up without using Himachi.

item.description:
@makersprivate123 wrote:

Host Gushers:

really what i do is go client sided and source sided and search for server in client.java then i go into gui.java…I dont know why you dont have that.

I have JFrame.java, I think that should work as GUI, because I edit like client window title and stuff inside there… but I can’t find any to change a IP…

item.title: Need help with PI for my beta team to get access to my server. Hamachi
item.dc:creator: @makersprivate123 makersprivate123
item.description:
@makersprivate123 wrote:

[quote=“iBunnie, post:5, topic:472494”][quote author=makersprivate123 link=topic=590281.msg4178976#msg4178976 date=1355291618]

Did you portforward? also, check your skype.

You would not have to portforward for this at all. Sir, do you have a gui.java? or egui.java?

I know how to portforward and to use hamachi, I have been using it for years but somehow I couldn’t get it to work… I do not have Gui, I’ll check if I have EGui when I am on my computer! Thx!
[/quote]
No prob[/quote]
Nope, no EGUI.java

Read full topic
